com.nutiteq.tasks
Class CancelableThreadPoolExecutor

java.lang.Object
  java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService
      java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
          com.nutiteq.tasks.CancelableThreadPoolExecutor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.concurrent.Executor, java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService
public class CancelableThreadPoolExecutor
extends java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor

Special thread pool executor for tasks that support canceling. Also allows tasks to be associated with priorities, with tasks having higher priorities being executed before tasks having lower priorities.

Method Summary
 void cancelAll()
          Cancel all tasks that are queued and not yet started executing.
 void execute(java.lang.Runnable command)
          Execute task with default priority.
 void execute(java.lang.Runnable command, int priority)
          Execute task with given priority.
 

Method Detail

execute

public void execute(java.lang.Runnable command,
                    int priority)
Execute task with given priority. Tasks will be queued and processed according to priorities.

Parameters:
command - task to execute.
priority - task relative priority. Default priority is 0.

execute

public void execute(java.lang.Runnable command)
Execute task with default priority. Tasks will be queued and processed according to priorities.

Overrides:
execute in class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
Parameters:
command - task to execute.

cancelAll

public void cancelAll()
Cancel all tasks that are queued and not yet started executing. If any queued task is an instance of com.nutiteq.Task, then isCancelable() method is called first to determine if the task can be cancelled. If task can be canceled, then cancel() method is called afterwards.
